body:
@vinothchandar Thanks,  now the performance is similar after i set the parallelism to 2. 
They have only few second difference.  Since setting high parallelism for low volume of data is causing in high data ingestion latency. When should we start increasing the parallelism for getting low data latency (What volume of data as a threshold )?
I am doing POC on MapR platform to build the datafabric in incremental fashion and for ETL offload needs.

I used mapR live online with hive 2.3 without any issues.But same thing is not working for hive 2.1 in our environment.
I used same build command on both the environment.
@vinothchandar I was already in the mailing list. My JIRA id was: garyli1019. Thanks!
Made a https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-146 and assigned to you for now.. We can work together on this there.. Please let me know if you have thoughts on getting started

Great! 
Hudi writing is just an (advanced) spark job, so scaling tips that apply for spark also apply here generally. Defaults were tuned to 1500, to help handle upto 500GB input by default. I would increase parallelism by 1 for every 1GB of additional data (rough guess, you can easily experiment with values and see).. Please close this issue if things look good.
@leilinen @amaranathv do you mind providing details of your organizations/teams to add to the blurb
Thanks @eisig Merging this change

@n3nash @vinothchandar : Most of the changes are about adding NOTICE.txt and LICENSE.txt files to both source directories and in jars.  POM Changes are about automating this step. If any dependency is added/removed, it will automatically reflect in NOTICE.txt and be part of code-review.
cc @ovj
Hi, This task has been unassigned. I would like to pick this up. Could you please help me out here? Where to start
@chandresh-pancholi if you give us your jira id, I can assign HUDI-62 to you. is that something you are interested in?

@bvaradar All changes as per the comments are fixed apart of pom.xml (reason mentioned on the individual comment). Also, double checked stylesheets issues and found that some source files are not following it correctly. Thanks.
Thanks.  This is so helpful.
@vinothchandar @n3nash : This is plain licensing change for all files. Please review and merge when you get a chance.
@n3nash is this WIP?

Hi.  Yes. you can use any Spark datasource to extract a dataframe and write it out as Hudi dataset. High level, seems like you are looking for efficient ways of tailing Oracle via JDBC. In that case, there are probably tools like Sqoop, Kafka Connect (have not use it myself) that can help extract from Oracle nicely?. Happy to help more, but there are general spark/oracle issues. 

Also please join our mailing lists https://hudi.apache.org/community.html and post follow ups there, if you dont mind.
I have another problem. If I add `--filter-dupes`, even if I stop the spark context, the driver will not exit after the executors exit. So I need to test more.

@vinothchandar Addressed comments. I have some basic query successes from the internal tests, I can share screenshots i think. How do you want me to share the docker test results ? (I'll have to run them again)
That is weird. let me repro and get back.
@n3nash are you planning to fix the rollback handling also in the reverse reading of the schema? I may also need something like that for log indexing
@vinothchandar Planning on doing that in a follow up PR but after hoodie-bench though.
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-12 points to this PR : https://github.com/apache/incubator-hudi/pull/638

Hi! Can I be added to slack please? kim@logicalclocks.com 
I already joined the mailinglist.
Cheers, Kim
This is merged.
HI I think scope for GSON is limited to test we might need to change scope to compile to make this work.

Most likely your environment is bringing some Hive 1.x jar and the class loader is loading classes from there. The method signature of alter_table indicates this. Please try to ensure you use Hive 2.3 in your env  as well (since it worked) and that no other hive 1.x libs are present.
Closing, please reopen if needed
@bvaradar can we also do TestMergeOnReadTable
@vinothchandar it is not, I've removed the tag.
@vinothchandar Waiting for you to accept, can merge this then.
@n3nash can you rebase against latest master and push again.. We are waiting to stabilize the CI, before merging
Yes, I rebased and pushed last night. This should not increase the instability, not many tests added.
@n3nash : Please merge when you review this PR and ok with it.

Seems like this is due to hoodie-common POM using the hadoop-common and hadoop-hdfs modules with tests classifier. I was able to hoodie to build against 2.8.4 by simply adding these modules in hoodie-common pom.xml. 

    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.apache.hadoop</groupId>
      <artifactId>hadoop-hdfs</artifactId>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.apache.hadoop</groupId>
      <artifactId>hadoop-common</artifactId>
    </dependency>
Hi  @jaimin-shah Will take a look at this sometime over hte weekend. Been having some travis CI issues lately, that is keeping few of us pretty busy .. :(

Opened PR:

https://github.com/apache/incubator-hudi/pull/739
@vinothchandar : Addressed review comments;
@abhioncbr : Looks close to finish. Would you be able to finish up this PR ?

```xml
<!-- https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.hadoop/hadoop-common -->
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.apache.hadoop</groupId>
    <artifactId>hadoop-common</artifactId>
    <version>3.1.1.3.0.2.0-50</version>
</dependency>
```
Maybe you can replace hadoop ,spark, hive's version and repackage hoodie and then try again.

@amaranathv sorry about that. can you use `hoodie-utilities-bundle` jar instead of hoodie-utilities? The docs have been updated in the *.md files, but the site has not been regenerated yet. 
https://github.com/apache/incubator-hudi/blob/asf-site/docs/writing_data.md#deltastreamer
@tokaaron this looks good in general. do you think we should also depend explicitly on `hadoop-common` (just like `hadoop-hdfs`)?

Left 1 comment.. otherwise looks good.. 

We are in fact plannign to do a small hackathon to understand and rethink jar packaging in Hudi. Let us know if there are more gaps or if you'd like to be a part of it.

yes.. building it for those specific hadoop versions could help. We have not yet tested on hadoop 3. Let us know if you run into issues.. 
Also please join our mailing list as well, for faster responses. https://hudi.apache.org/community.html

IIUC @garyli1019 got it working.. So your issue might be different?

this line is curious..
would changing the storage level for the write status help? In general, persisting that (disk or memory) is key to handling spark level retries/recomputations of that RDD :)

@nadeemnehru You can use `hoodie-0.4.7` release if you want to use Hive 1.x. Going forward, Hudi support Hive 2.x on-wards. We will soon update the docs (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-160)

Thanks @n3nash 
I am really a beginner with maven. So would be grateful if you could share how I can undo the changes that happened by running:  
`mvn clean install -DskipTests -Dhadoop.version=2.6.0-cdh5.7.2 -Dhive.version=1.1.0-cdh5.7.2`  

Also I downloaded the source code archive for hoodie-0.4.7 from https://github.com/apache/incubator-hudi/archive/hoodie-0.4.7.tar.gz and extracted it.  
Do I need to use the same command from incubator-hudi-hoodie-0.4.7 folder to build hoodie  

Thanks for help
You can checkout the hoodie `0.4.7` from here : https://github.com/apache/incubator-hudi/tree/hoodie-0.4.7 and then use `mvn clean install -DskipTests -DskipITs` to build it

Thanks @n3nash 
The build completed successfully for hoodie 0.4.7
Can you please help on this to complete the POC.

@amaranathv : The invalid dataset is not an error message per se.
Apache Hudi implements optimistic concurrency for guaranteeing Key uniqueness even in the face of Spark Stage level retries. This message merely indicates that some Stage level retry happened during ingestion and Hudi identified some duplicate files that got created. Hudi will remove this file before committing the data. 
So, this message is innocuous. 

Are you noticing any record loss ?
Spark status shows as success but i didn't see any output files in the target directory and also i didn't see any logs that shows sample records and other details .
it is printing what ever i had attached in previous reply.

@amaranathv : To debug further,  Can you "ls" .hoodie folder and cat all the the ".deltacommit/.commit" files. 

Also, if possible Can you attach the get the spark logs  and Spark UI screenshot

```
Tests in error: 
  TestHoodieDeltaStreamer.testUpsertsCOWContinuousMode:313->testUpsertsContinuousMode:353 Ã‚Â» Execution
``` 

is this test being flaky?

@RonBarabash is this some transient failure? I think this option can help with such failures, but if there are real permanent failures in archiving, then the timeline keeps growing out of bounds and things will start slwoing down..  I am wondering if we should first attempt to fix why there were empty commits..  
Do you have more information on that?

Hey @vinothchandar, thanks for the response!
This error occurred sporadically after a running a streaming application for a couple of days.
Our setup is like so: 
We use Hudi as an output writer for a structured streaming job, which is dockerized and then runs on Nomad.  The input is an event stream from Kafka and we write to output to S3.
My guess is that we might be loosing spark executors before Hudi finalise the writing of the .commit file and therefore it is empty, but its just a speculation, i didn't saw this scenario in the logs or metrics.. 
Another options is something to do with S3  eventual consistency, we are using `hoodie.consistency.check.enabled = true` in our run...

How about ignoring empty commit files? or re-writing the commit if its empty?

Nonetheless, we had to debug the application in order to understand the name of the damaged file, the log is important to understand that without actually debugging the app...
@n3nash @vinothchandar : This is to fix ConcurrentModification Exception seen when using deltastreamer in long-running mode.

@amaranathv : Can you rebuild Hudi with this patch https://github.com/apache/incubator-hudi/pull/756 and let me know if you are able to write. I can merge the PR if it works for you.
I am rebuilding it.Will update the status once it is complete.
@amaranathv : Thanks. Also join the mailing list and slack channel if you have not

Hey,
We are using Hudi at Yotpo for several usages.
Firstly, we integrated Hudi as a writer in our open source ETL framework: https://github.com/YotpoLtd/metorikku 
We currently use it as an output writer for a CDC pipeline - 
Events that are being generated from a database binlog streams to Kafka and then are written to S3. The cool thing with Hudi is that it helps maintain a consistent view of the data in our data lake when we dont need to merge the deletes and upserts ourselves.
A blog post on that is being written and ill share it here once its done :)

More usages are coming,
10x
Ron

I am part of mailing list.I will ad to slack channel soon.

@n3nash @vinothchandar : @amaranathv  confirmed this patch works with MapR ecosystem
Awesome. Closing this issue.

@vinothchandar yes. I have a hive table with decimal column. 
When I used `run_sync_tool.sh` to sync a hoodie data to hive table, hoodie used hive jdbc to read hive schema and checked difference from hive and hoodie. I found a decimal column in hive table didn't have precision and scale, but hoodie table had, so that hoodie thought they were different column type and reported error.

I found this problem when I revised a change about not using `com.databricks:spark-avro_2.11` and letting hoodie support timestamp and decimal column type below spark2.4. 
I have completed spark test about supporting timestamp and decimal column type but have some problem in testing hive. When I finish testing I will take a PR.

Can you show your schema and write data?
In spark2.3, spark use avro1.7, if you want to use avro1.8, you need to replace your SPARK_HOME/jars/avro* to avro1.8.

Thanks for cdmikechen's comment.

Data schema is 'com.uber.hoodie' . run_hoodie_app.sh is is hudi demo script in hoodie-spark project. My command is './run_hoodie_app.sh' without any parameter.  HoodieJavaApp launch spark on LOCAL model . 

I had repleaced all arvo*-1.7 to avro*-1.8 but  return the same InvalidSchemaException
When I moved some hive2.* jars to SPARK_HOME/jars/ and then wrote some data to parquet, it reported error like that. Were you doing something like this?
